DOC.brief_summary: To characterize the GORE® Hybrid Vascular Graft as compared to non-heparin bonded synthetic vascular grafts in terms of the prevalence and persistence of anti-platelet factor 4 / heparin antibodies (anti-PF4 / H antibodies).
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Anti-platelet Factor 4/Heparin Antibodies in Hemodialysis Patients
DOC.criteria: The patient is not a candidate for a native fistula. The patient requires the creation of an upper arm vascular access graft for hemodialysis secondary to a diagnosis of EndStage Renal Disease. The patient has been on hemodialysis for ≥1 month. The patient is scheduled for a different surgical procedure within 30 days post Index Procedure. The patient has a known hypercoagulable disorder or bleeding disorder. The patient has had a previous instance of Heparin Induced Thrombocytopenia Type II (HIT type II) or has known sensitivity to heparin.
